channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Bharat Bandh: Which states are most affected?
India’s new CPI explained: How will the 2024 inflation reset impact you?
Google offers voluntary exit packages to employees. Is AI the reason?
Who is Jim Ratcliffe, Manchester United co-owner who said ‘UK has been colonised by immigrants’?
How Mexican cartel drones led to shutdown of Texas’s El Paso airport
Who was Jesse van Rootselaar, 18-year-old transgender behind Canada's school shooting?
From Berbera to Bab el-Mandeb: Enter the New Great Game in the Horn of Africa
item.description: As Somaliland enters the diplomatic spotlight, the Horn of Africa is fast becoming the epicentre of a new great-power contest over the Red Sea and global trade routes

item.title: How Jamaat breaks free of BNP’s shadow to emerge as a power centre in Bangladesh polls
item.description: The Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami leads an 11-party alliance, formalised in late 2025, bringing together traditional Islamist forces like Bangladesh Khelafat Majlis and Nezame-e-Islam, as well as an apparently secular force in the form of the National Citizen Party

item.title: What Takaichi’s ‘wonderful and rearmed’ Japan will have for India
item.description: Sanae Takaichi views India as a civilisational ally, and in the Takaichi-Modi era, the Indo-Pacific has a new, formidable, evolving axis

item.title: How great empires rise and fall: A cue to America’s fate
item.description: Like Ottoman, Mughal, Qing and British, America’s decline will be gradual

item.title: How Trump is pursuing America First in the Ukraine war and Iran crisis
item.description: On Ukraine, the US is keen to draw Russia away from China, while in Iran its focus has shifted from supporting protestors to military and nuclear issues, signalling that it does not anticipate a regime change in the near future

item.title: A big step in the right direction: Decoding the India-US interim trade deal
item.description: The India-US interim trade agreement is a significant, positive development in bilateral economic ties. Yet, the broader relationship remains subject to the unpredictable whims and transactional demands of the Trump administration
